# md.succ.ai

> HTML to clean Markdown API. Convert any webpage to readable Markdown optimized for AI consumption.

## What it does

md.succ.ai converts any URL to clean Markdown using Mozilla Readability for content extraction. It strips navigation, sidebars, footers, and ads — returning only the article content.

## API Usage

No API key required. No authentication. No rate limits for reasonable use.

### Endpoints

- GET https://md.succ.ai/{url} — convert URL to Markdown
- GET https://md.succ.ai/?url={url} — query param format
- GET https://md.succ.ai/health — health check

### Example

```
curl https://md.succ.ai/https://example.com
```

### JSON Response (Accept: application/json)

```json
{
  "title": "Example Domain",
  "url": "https://example.com",
  "content": "# Example Domain\n\nThis domain is for use in documentation...",
  "tokens": 33,
  "tier": "fetch",
  "readability": true,
  "time_ms": 245,
  "excerpt": "This domain is for use in...",
  "byline": "",
  "siteName": ""
}
```

### Response Headers

- x-markdown-tokens: cl100k_base token count
- x-conversion-tier: "fetch" or "browser"
- x-conversion-time: conversion time in milliseconds
- x-readability: whether Readability extraction succeeded

## Two-Tier Pipeline

1. **Tier 1 (fast)**: Plain HTTP fetch + Readability + Turndown (200-500ms for static pages)
2. **Tier 2 (fallback)**: Playwright headless Chromium for SPAs and JS-heavy sites (3-15s)

Automatic detection — no configuration needed.

## Self-Hosting

```bash
git clone https://github.com/vinaes/md-succ-ai.git
cd md-succ-ai
docker compose up -d
```

Available at localhost:3100. Docker image includes Chromium.

## Use Cases

- AI agent web browsing (MCP tools, function calling)
- RAG pipeline document ingestion
- Content extraction for LLM context windows
- Web research automation
- Documentation scraping

## Technology

- Node.js 22, Hono framework
- Mozilla Readability (content extraction)
- Turndown (HTML to Markdown)
- Playwright (headless Chromium for SPAs)
- gpt-tokenizer (cl100k_base token counting)
